queries.description: Unconstrained use of goto can lead to unstructured code.
queries.name: The goto statement shall jump to a label declared later in the same function

RULE-15-2.title: The goto statement shall jump to a label declared later in the same function

queries.description: Any label referenced by a goto statement shall be declared in the same block, or in any block enclosing the goto statement.
queries.name: The goto statement and any of its label shall be declared or enclosed in the same block

RULE-15-3.title: Any label referenced by a goto statement shall be declared in the same block, or in any block enclosing the goto statement

queries.description: More than one break or goto statement in iteration conditions may lead to readability and maintainability issues.
queries.name: There should be no more than one break or goto statement used to terminate any iteration statement

RULE-15-4.title: There should be no more than one break or goto statement used to terminate any iteration statement

queries.description: Switch Statements with a single path are redundant and may cause programming errors.
queries.name: Every switch statement shall have at least two switch-clauses

RULE-16-6.title: Every switch statement shall have at least two switch-clauses

queries.description: An `if-else` construct is more appropriate for boolean controlled expression.
queries.name: A switch-expression shall not have essentially Boolean type

RULE-16-7.title: A switch-expression shall not have essentially Boolean type
